AccountManageIndexTxt: Select appropriate tab on the left hand side to alter your account's data
TFAuthDesc: Your login is protected with an authenticator app. Enter your authenticator code below
NoAccessToAuthDeviceTxt1: Don't have access to your authenticator device? You can
NoAccessToAuthDeviceTxt2: log in with a recovery code
RecoveryCodeVerificationTxt: You have requested to log in with a recovery code. This login will not be remembered until you provide, an authenticator app code at log in or disable 2FA and log in again.
DisconnectedConnectFormMsg: In order to start setting up payment vendor, please select below
RestrictedConnectFormMsg: For some reason, you've stopped Stripe onboarding. In order to continue your last attempt on payment setup, please select below
PendingSaveMsg: You've submitted new account to Stripe recently, come back after a minute or so to check how it's going
StripeConnectedMsg: Your MyHub is fully connected to the Stripe infrastructure and you're free to create your subscription plan
ForgotPasswordConfirmationTxt: Please check your email to reset your password
EmailWasNotSentDueToErrorTxt1: Email to confirm your account has not been sent due to unexpected error
EmailWasNotSentDueToErrorTxt2: Try to resend this email by
ConfirmAccountTxt2: Please click the link sent in email to confirm your account
DeletePersonalDataTxt1: Deleting this data will immediately remove your account, and this is irreversible
DeletePersonalDataTxt2: Subscribers who remove their data from the service before the end of the current billing period will lose access to purchased content - the remaining subscription period will be forfeited
DeletePersonalDataTxt3: If you have placed an order for content access and are within the 14-day withdrawal period, account deletion will be equivalent to withdrawing from the contract according to the terms and conditions
DeletePersonalDataBtnTxt: Delete my data and close the account
Disable2FATxt1: Disabling 2FA does not change the keys used in authenticator apps. If you wish to change the key used in an authenticator app you should
ConfirmEmailSubject: Change the email associated with your account
EmailIsUnchanged: The email address has not been changed
RegisterMailSubject: You have received this email because you registered a new account at
EnableAuthenticatorHeader: To start using an authenticator app, follow the steps below
DownloadAuthAppTxt1: Download a two-factor authentication app like Microsoft Authenticator or Google Authenticator to your device
DownloadAuthAppTxt4: After entering the above key, your two-factor authentication app will display a unique code. Enter this code in the confirmation below
ForgotPasswordEmailTxt: You've asked to reset your password at
AddExternalLoginTitle: Add another service to log in
PutTheseCodesInASafePlace: Put these codes in a safe place
Generate2FARecoveryCodesTxt1: If you lose your device and don't have the recovery codes you will lose access to your account
Generate2FARecoveryCodesTxt2: Generating new recovery codes does not change the keys used in authenticator apps. If you wish to change the key used in an authenticator app you should
ResetAuthenticatorKeyTxt1: If you reset your authenticator key your authenticator app will not work until you reconfigure it
ResetAuthenticatorKeyTxt2: This process disables 2FA until you verify your authenticator app. If you do not complete your authenticator app configuration you may lose access to your account.
GenerateANewSetOfRecoveryCodes: Generate a new set of recovery codes
BeforeYouCanLoginWithARecoveryCode: before you can login using a recovery code
PrivacyCookieNotAccepted: Privacy and cookie policy have not been accepted
YouMustAcceptThePolicy: You must accept the policy before you can enable two factor authentication
PersonalDataTxt1: Your account contains personal data that you have given us. This page allows you to download or delete that data.
PersonalDataTxt2: Deleting this data will permanently remove your account, and this cannot be recovered
